revisionDesc.change: Submit - Text in l. 3 emended after D. Hagedorn, ZPE 185 (2013) 200.
Vote - AcceptText - Accept. See Sosin's note on proper encoding.
Vote - AcceptText - Accept. But encoding must be changed to: <:Ὑμέναιος=PN P.James|ed|Ὑμεναῖος:>

Submit - As noted in the description of changes, I have harmonised the accent on the personal name Hymenaeus with its accentuation in several authorities and by analogy with the contrast between the properispomenon ethnic adjective Ἀθηναῖος and the proparoxytone personal name Ἀθήναιος (as it is accented in the LGPN, some 490 times). See The Classical Review 63.2 (2013) 389, but note that the adjective is also proparoxytone in LSJ (despite the rule, but not the examples, in Chandler, section 378, where note too except(ion) 2.).

Commit - Accent corrected on the personal name Hymenaios inline with the accentuation in vols. of Inscriptiones Graecae., Moulton-Milligan, Pape-Benseler, and BDAG (pace LGPN I): cf. Athenaios properispomenon for the ethnic, but Athenaios proparoxytone for the personal name
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - lin11 use better apostrophe lin19 num tag on day date
entered text from the printed edition. lin.12 corrected accent: ἀναγκαιόν ἐστι-> ἀναγκαῖόν ἐστι

div.ab:
ὙμέναιοςὙμεναῖος Διονυσίωι
τῶι τιμιωτάτωι χαίρειν.
τὸ ἐπιστόλιον οὖναὐτὸ ὃ διε
πεμψάμην σοι
ἑσπέρας διὰ τοῦ Αἰθίοπός
σου ὥστε Θέωνι
τῷ στρατηγῷ τοῦ Προ
σωπίτου δοῦναι,
καλῶς ποιήσεις
δοὺς Κέρδωνι τῷ
παρ’ ἡμῶν, ἐπεὶ
ἀναγκαῖόν ἐστι
καὶ μέλλει αὐτὸς
πεζεύειν. ἐρρῶ
σθαί σε εὔχομαι
τιμιώτατε.
καὶ εὐθέως αὐτῷ
δὸς τὸ ἐπιστόλιον.
ἔρρωσο. Παχὼν κγ.
